block.p: Lekha Menon and Jason Richard Patrick were married in a civil ceremony on Wednesday by Blanca Ramos, a deputy city clerk at the New York City Municipal Building. On March 11, the couple had a Hindu ceremony at the Guruvayur Temple in Guruvayur, India, which was led by Sri Vaidyanathan Namboothiripad, a priest.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She is the director of research and donor relations in the fund-raising department at New York University. She graduated from Barnard College. She is a daughter of Jayshree and Unni Menon of Durham, N.C. Her father retired as an engineer in the Ras Tanura, Saudi Arabia, office of Saudi Aramco, the oil company.

She is a daughter of Jayshree and Unni Menon of Durham, N.C. Her father retired as an engineer in the Ras Tanura, Saudi Arabia, office of Saudi Aramco, the oil company.

The bridegroom, 29, is a scientist at Environmental Defense, formerly called the Environmental Defense Fund, a nonprofit organization specializing in scientific, economic and legal analysis of environmental issues in New York. He graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and received a master's degree in environmental management from Yale. His parents work at Middlesex Community College in Middleton, Conn., where the bridegroom's mother is a professor of art and the chairwoman of the art department and his father is a political science professor and chairman of the political science department.
